title: Astronomy Vocabulary
description: Space and astronomy terms and definitions

questions.question: What is a 'nebula'?
options: A giant cloud of dust and gas in space

questions.question: What is a 'supernova'?
options: A massive explosion that occurs when a star reaches the end of its life

questions.question: What is the 'ecliptic'?
options: The apparent path of the Sun across the sky over a year
The dark side of the Moon

questions.question: What is a 'constellation'?
options: A group of stars forming a recognizable pattern as seen from Earth

questions.question: What is a 'black hole'?
options: A hole in the ozone layer
An empty area of space with no stars
A region of space with gravity so strong that nothing can escape it
A dark spot on the Sun

questions.question: What does 'astronomical unit' (AU) measure?
options: The distance from the Earth to the Sun

questions.question: What is the 'Milky Way'?
options: The galaxy that contains our solar system

questions.question: What is a 'satellite' in astronomy?
options: Any object that orbits a larger object in space

questions.question: What is 'solar wind'?
options: A stream of charged particles released from the Sun's atmosphere
Wind power generated by solar panels
A type of hurricane on Jupiter

questions.question: What is an 'exoplanet'?
options: A planet made entirely of gas
A planet that orbits a star outside our solar system
A planet that no longer exists

questions.question: What does 'orbit' mean?
options: The curved path of an object around a star, planet, or moon
To float in space without direction

questions.question: What is a 'red dwarf'?
options: A small, cool, and relatively dim star
A planet with a red surface

questions.question: What is the 'aurora borealis'?
options: A constellation in the southern sky
Natural light displays in the northern sky caused by solar particles
A star visible only at dawn

questions.question: What is a 'comet'?
options: An icy body that releases gas and dust, forming a visible tail as it approaches the Sun
A fragment of a broken planet
